question: 大体
sourceMnemonic: If all you can see is the <kanji>big</kanji> <kanji>body</kanji> of something, then you'll only get a <vocabulary>general</vocabulary> idea of what it is. You'll be able to say that it's <vocabulary>generally</vocabulary> a certain way, but that's <vocabulary>about</vocabulary> all. You'll get the <vocabulary>gist</vocabulary>, but no more.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. Since <ja>大</ja> has two on'yomi readings, here's a mnemonic to help you remember which one to use:

<vocabulary>Generally</vocabulary>, it's a bad idea to <reading>dye</reading> your <reading>tie</reading>s (<ja>だいたい</ja>). The tie police isn't a big fan of it, and you wouldn't wanna get arrested!
